1397283150405898241.text: "Some of it would flow downstream, but prior to Klamath Project would go into a basin and mostly evaporate, more so that it does today." - Dan Keppen #WesternWater

1397276741266067458.text: If agriculture hadn’t stored water in the Klamath in the first place, where would be today? #WesternWater #orag

1397276108274372609.text: “In the Klamath basin one drop of water can be reused up to 7x” - Dan Keppen #WesternWater #orag

1397274424114515969.text: “The endangered species act is not being implemented in the way that promotes species recovery. We need to work with landowners to incentivize recovery.” - Dan Keppen #WesternWater

1397274067326050308.text: I want to make sure @RepLaMalfa & I’s bill to bring relief to Klamath basin will also help meet the needs of the Yurok’s request as well. #WesternRiver

1397268654593495040.text: "Such projects can benefit wildlife and wetlands as well as food production. An immediate and local response is imperative." - Dan Keppen #WesternWater

1397268591049805824.text: "Farmers and ranchers need programs through their local NRCS offices to assist with the purchase of infrastructure-- including solar panels, pipeline materials, well-drilling, tanks, gated pipe and projects to develop water." - Dan Keppen #WesternWater

1397268474586570753.text: "In the short term, We recommend a fast-track response capability from the USDA and Interior that enables a localized response by farmers and ranchers. " - Dan Keppen #WesternWater

1397267997123768324.text: "There are critical parties in the Basin that could help make this happen, and Klamath Basin interests need support for this effort from the state and federal governments and our local communities. It can be done; it has been done elsewhere." - Dan Keppen #westernWater

1397267917750685696.text: "For long-term stability, a basin-wide settlement agreement is needed that would address water management for irrigation and fish and provide a fair and legal treatment of the Klamath Project irrigators and their families. " - Dan Keppen #WesternWater

1397267242031583233.text: "The American food consumer nationwide has access to fruits, vegetables, nuts, grains and beef throughout the year largely because of Western irrigated agriculture and the projects that provide water to these farmers and ranchers." - Dan Keppen #westernWater

1397267078248230913.text: Really great to have my constituent Dan Keppen and executive director of Family Farm Alliance here today as a witness on my committee! #westernWater

1397259833322049538.text: Waiting for the courts to sort this out is not the right approach. #westernWater

1397259590295715840.text: "Ms Klein, is there something we should be doing with our laws so we take a more holistic approach to solving the issues facing our communities as their livelihoods dry up?" #westernwater

1397258675635458050.text: The loss to the Klamath Basin, 200,00 acres dried up...is $400 Million dollars lost to that community. #westernwater #orag

1397247840359964680.text: "Managed forests and healthy forests and overall more resilient to drought, fire...." - Idaho State Forester Mr. Foss #westernwater #WesternForests

1397240747431284747.text:
"Forests and water are dependent on one another.
Healthy forests mean increased water quantity and unhealthy, burned out forests lead to water quality and water supply problems." - @RepWesterman #westernwater #WesternForests

1397240366051495941.text: "Our current policies fail to measure accountability and results for environmental actions, and our bureaucracy has a paralysis-by-analysis approach when it comes to building new infrastructure." - @RepWesterman #westernWater

1397239766832267272.text: Short term solutions of money and water conservation will repair the problem, we need long term solutions like more water storage and less cumbersome regulations. #westernwater

1397239140673011716.text: Without water food does not grow and our local food supply will not exist and we will depend on foreign sources for food. #westernwater #orag #klamath

1397238952776589315.text: This water uncertainty has been going on for decades, despite previous administrations trying to do things about it. #WesternWater

1397238590913003526.text: The impact of the #WesternWater Drought is about 70 million people.

1383086818552279040.text: Thank you everyone who followed along with the @NatResources GOP #WhereAreTheJobs forum.

1383086006191022087.text: "This new infrastructure bills seems more like a stimulus package for the Chinese Government" - Out of work Pipeline worker #WhereAreTheJobs

1383085045255004160.text: "When you see bans on oil and natural gas everything comes to a screeching halt which comes with a devastating impact to our communities" #WhereAreTheJobs

1383084555456770049.text: We have the highest safety and environmental standards to ensure we have clean air and water in energy these operations and the communities they operate in. #WhereAreTheJobs

1383083450630950916.text: "We are told to transition these jobs (Clean Energy) which don't even exist at the moment" #WhereAreTheJobs

1383083318057394183.text: "We should support all jobs, not just "clean energy" jobs"  #WhereAreTheJobs

1383082731874131969.text: Colorado is expected to lose 16,000 jobs to the #BidenBan on federal land leases for oil & gas. - @RepBoebert #WhereAreTheJobs

1383081660015472645.text: The workers at Berg Pipe cannot just go find another job, they are highly skilled specialized workers. It's offensive to tell them just to go get a lower paying job that may not necessarily provide for their family.

1383080318660341763.text: I grew up on a ranch and the 300 tons of hay we put up each year was all done with diesel equipment and petroleum lubricants. #WhereAreTheJobs

1383079179407613961.text: "A 40% price increase of lubricants is huge hit our forestry and manufacturing partners and they have put projects on hold because of increased costs of raw materials" -Trent Tyree #WhereAreTheJobs #OR02

1383078379633606660.text: "Diesel is needed to get trucks to forest fires and we need drivers to get diesel to those trucks and to the rural communities we serve" - Trent Tyree #WhereAreThoseJobs

1383078163496931335.text: Oregon is suffering an incredible drought which means more wildfires, with Tyree's shortage of drivers how will this impact responding to them? #WhereAreTheJobs

1383075687385292813.text: "57% of American Energy Independence on Federal Land comes from New Mexico" #WhereAreTheJobs

1383075409835687940.text: "These bans are being done in the name of climate change and the environment, but we know that's true because of what's happening in China and how our foreign enemies with benefit" #WhereAreTheJobs

1383074299129466883.text: 60 jobs lost in a county of 1700 people has a HUGE rippling negative impact on the local hospital, schools and grocery stores. #FallonCounty #WhereAreTheJobs

1383073995130478594.text: Fallon County Montana will not receive the $7 million dollars from #KeystoneXL pipeline, thanks to Biden's Exec Orders. #WhereAreTheJobs #RevenueLost

1383072685949734916.text: ICYMI: I am participating in the House Natural Resources Republican Forum: “Where are the Jobs?” I am sharing stories from around the country. https://t.co/03Ct36aTxO via @YouTube #WhereAreTheJobs

1383071511360073730.text: "If the politicians lost their jobs right now would they go build solar panels" - Union worker #WhereAreTheJobs

1383071274910437376.text: Pipeline workers are in constant training to continually improve to be better and more efficient. Safety is #1 #2 #3 priorities to these workers. #WhereAreTheJobs

1383070819241234432.text: "Pipeline work is long hours and hard work and you become family with your coworkers and to be told we don't want what you do and you're not doing a good job is a slap in the face" Union Pipeline worker #WhereAreTheJobs

1383069492566056961.text: "Gas has gone up one dollar is first 140 days of the Biden Administration" - Rep Young #WhereAreTheJobs

1383068898883342338.text: There are no solar panels being built in the Kaktovik community in ANWR. #WhereAreTheJobs

1383068290205904901.text: "We've experience a 40% increase in cost and we are bracing for this to continue with the Biden executive orders" #WhereAreTheJobs

1383068092595507201.text: "We are struggling to find workers because of stimulus payments incentivize people not work"

1383067735593127941.text: "I grew up in a community that was devastated by knee jerk environmental decisions"

1383067523759804420.text: Trent Tyree of Tyree Oil is my witness today. #OR02 #WhereAreTheJobs

1383067287121371140.text:
"And let’s not forget, the people...the people
leading the charge are my incredibly talented colleagues...the engineers, scientists,
environmentalists, truckers, rig hands and others who comprise our industry." #WhereAreTheJobs

1383067181605289990.text: "In Colorado, we’re actively reducing our emissions and constantly improving our technologies to make our industry better, safer and cleaner than anywhere else in the world."  #WhereAreTheJobs

1383066885990719488.text:
"We all know you can’t turn up the sun to power solar panels or make the wind blow harder through our
turbines. Only fossil fuels like natural gas can be flexible to meet demand." #WhereAreTheJobs

1383066819393585154.text:
"We have rural households powered by propone and
natural gas that both heat our homes and keep our food cold. On those hottest days and coldest polar vortexes, our urban residents need the ability to ramp up power to meet demand." WhereAreTheJobs

1383066737214586883.text: "While it may be good politics and fodder for the beltway, moving entirely away from fossil fuels is a utopian dream only capable of thriving in a place like Washington DC. In Colorado, it gets cold in the winter and hot in the summer." #WhereAreTheJobs

1383066480716107782.text: Chelsie Miera, the Executive Director of the West Slope Colorado Oil and Gas Association is now up. #WhereAreTheJobs

1383065928133320708.text: "With an indefinite leasing ban on federal lands alone, the American Petroleum Institute estimates that New Mexico will lose 62,000 jobs over the next 21-months." #WhereAreTheJobs

1383065849628557314.text: "Petroleum funds 1/3rd of New Mexico state budget, which finances education, public safety and infrastructure. Likewise, our industry directly and indirectly employs 134,000 people, which accounts for 13% of total state labor income."

1383065640584454149.text: "54% of New Mexico’s oil comes from federal lands and mineral rights" #WhereAreTheJobs

1383065209368027136.text: "And lastly, the lift boats that came from Cut Off, Louisiana, to help erect those windmills did not get up there on by themselves. They were propelled with diesel engines." LaFourche Parrish President Chaisson #WhereAreTheJobs

1383065086491717634.text: The wind farms that dot the east coast and other parts of our country need to be lubricated and you cannot do that with sunflower seed oil, you need a petroleum product." #WhereAreTheJobs

1383064971358048257.text: "As the Biden Administration moves to renewable, they are asking us to pretend that oil and gas just does not exist. In reality, those lithium batteries that power their electric cars come from mines in Mexico that are powered by generators fed with natural gas" #WhereAreTheJobs

1383064756781674498.text: "For every 1 job lost there are 3 others lost in our region. On a state level that number is much worse. For every 1 job lost there are 5 others lost somewhere in the economy." Lafourche Parrish President Chaisson #WhereAreTheJobs

1383064570206425090.text: "Just to give you a glimpse as to what this industry means to the Bayou Region, we have 8,015 jobs tied strictly to Port Fourchon with another 10,000 or so tied to the oil and gas industry." #WhereAreTheJobs

1383064342854135808.text: The president of Lafourche Parrish is up, the LaFource Port which services over 90% of the deep water oil & gas in the Gulf of Mexico. #WhereAreTheJobs

1383063612906897412.text: In his are there is a coalition of community and business leaders who got together to invest in a rail spur to help diversify where their oil and products can go and Biden's policies have put that in jeopardy. #WhereAreTheJobs

1383063083975729157.text: Mayor Bird of Roosevelt, Utah is an energy worker himself, since Biden took office and the moratorium on drilling on Public Lands has negatively impacted his Utah community along with many other of his policies. #WhereAreTheJobs

1383061515503161346.text: "Why? Because some well funded environmental extremists latched onto the keystone xl as their rally point, demonizing it with little resistance." Union pipeline worker Patrick Thorssen #WhereAreTheJobs

1383061355280748558.text: "Canada will still sell their oil, but more will be shipped to Asian markets. Instead of America being energy independent, we're becoming more at the mercy of foreign governments."  #WhereAreTheJobs

1383061226033352709.text: "Canceling the xl won't reduce the carbon footprint in the US. Oil will continue to be consumed, but we'll have to rely more on oil imported from foreign countries." #WhereAreTheJobs

1383060811233390600.text: "What do you say to a man who's livelihood was taken away from him by an elected official who's answer was to go get a different job?"  Union Pipeline worker, Patrick Thorssen #WhereAreTheJobs

1383060696942841860.text: "I personally spoke with several friends who lost their jobs after Biden's executive order, the helplessness, the depression in their voices and in their eyes was heart-wrenching to me." Union Pipeline worker, Patrick Thorssen #WhereAreTheJobs

1383060281102790661.text:
"We understand the importance of green energy and why
it is a priority for the Administration. However, the transition from oil and natural gas cannot be
implemented overnight." - CEO Berg Pipe #WhereAreTheJobs

1383060138198663170.text:
"My colleagues are real people who want the best for their families. They want clean water, clean air, and
a healthy environment for future generations." - CEO Berg Pipe #WhereAreTheJobs

1383059933722079238.text:
"The general public might not understand that oil is not just used to make gasoline. We are
surrounded by petroleum products in our daily lives. Pharmaceuticals, plastics, electrical components,
contact lenses, & rubber are a few examples that improve our quality of life."

1383059574186340360.text: "January 2020, Berg employed 666 people fulltime in our Mobile, Alabama & Panama City, Florida pipe mills. Today, Berg only employs 147 people. A 78% decrease of Berg’s skilled workforce is a direct result of the current national energy policy." - CEO BergPipe  #WhereAreTheJobs

1383057501671727105.text: "...and let foreign regimes use fossil fuels as a political weapon as was done in the past before American’s energy renaissance.  Let’s keep our energy sources American made." - Rock Zierman #WhereAreTheJobs

1383057408683962369.text: "To cut off access to federal lands as has been proposed means we will import more oil from foreign countries and export our wealth, export our environmental leadership..." - Rock Zierman #WhereAreTheJobs

1383056159876161540.text: TUNE IN NOW: House Natural Resources Republican Forum: “Where are the Jobs?” https://t.co/03Ct36aTxO via @YouTube #WhereAreTheJobs

1383055851150184450.text: "These polices are hurting communities from Arkansas to Alaska"  -@RepWesterman #WhereAreTheJobs

1383055620891234305.text:
"Executive Order 13986 speaks to racial inequality and underserved communities – this is my community – we are an indigenous underserved community, yet we are
also the ones feeling the pain of EO 13990 by stalling leasing and permitting of programs." #WhereAreTheJobs

1383055355769278464.text:
"Kaktovik has fought for oil and gas
leasing in the Coastal Plain for decades, It was not until the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017 that we were able to realize our vision, a vision that has now appears to
have been extinguished by Executive Order 13990." #WhereAreTheJobs

1383055168778870787.text:
Mathew Rexford, from Kaktovik, AK. It is the
only community inside the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge, known as ANWR and
more importantly, the Kaktovikmiut are the only residents inside the Coastal Plain
of ANWR – the area opened for oil and gas leasing. #WhereAreTheJobs

1383054191384436739.text:
"I’ve spent 25 years in my trade and when I can work, I’m compensated accordingly. Starting over in another field means you’ll start at entry level positions with entry
level pay. That’s not an option for someone with mortgage payment, kids to raise, & health
coverage to provide"

1383053343820451847.text: Starting out the #WhereAreTheJobs forum is Neal Crabtree, a pipeline welder from Arkansas. With the strike of Biden's pen he was out of a job.

1383052603957800961.text: Biden promised a green job for displaced energy workers but has yet to deliver and now these once productive folks are on unemployment and dependent on the government.

1383052353176100865.text: With the cancellation of the #KeystoneXL pipeline thousands of jobs were immediately lost. #WhereAreTheJobs

1375167674003685385.text:
Portland is the nation's number one port for wheat exports with over 50% of the US wheat traveling down the Columbia-Snake River System! 
Wheat is Oregon's 6th most valuable crop and much of it can be found growing in Eastern Oregon. 
#NationalAgWeek #OregonsTopCrops #orag https://t.co/QQFZJbu3GE

1374765444058337280.text:
#DidYouKnow that Oregon produces 35% of the nation’s Kentucky Bluegrass seed, which primarily grown in Central and Eastern Oregon? 

From Oregon it goes into lawns, golf courses and sports stadiums across America. #NationalAgWeek #OregonsTopCrops #orag #GrownInOregon

1374380935341174796.text:
#DidYouKnow Oregon is #2 in US Onion production? You can find them mostly growing in the Eastern Oregon! #NationalAgWeek #OregonsTopCrops #orag #NationalAgDay

The onions pictured were grown on my farm in Ontario, Oregon. Green in June and harvested in September! https://t.co/72PNUArsfD

1374061024077176833.text:
Happy National Ag Week! 

#DidYouKnow Most of Oregon’s top 20 crops are grown in Oregon's Second Congressional District aka Eastern, Southern and Central Oregon! Can you guess which ones are not?  #NationalAgWeek #OregonsTopCrops #orag #GrownInOregon https://t.co/r3bIrXFuxB
